title: Sara Lee, Former WWE Wrestler and 'Tough Enough' Winner, Dies at 30; The powerlifter starred in the sixth season of the show in 2015 and won its fan vote
text:
"WWE offers its heartfelt condolences to her family, friends and fans," the company said.

Ms. Lee's cause of death wasn't disclosed.

Ms. Lee was from Hope Township, Mich. She was married to Cory Weston, a former WWE wrestler who was known in the ring as Wesley Blake.

"We are all in shock and arrangements are not complete," Ms. Lee's mother, Terri Lee, said in a Facebook post Thursday. "We ask that you respectfully let our family mourn. We all need prayers especially Cory and her children."

Sara Lee had three children.

She last posted on Instagram two days ago about how she earlier had a sinus infection but was healthy enough to go to the gym for two straight days.

In hersubmission video for WWE's "Tough Enough" published on YouTube in 2015, Ms. Lee touted how tough she was to viewers.

"Tough enough?" she asks viewers after chopping some wood with an ax. "From where I'm from, around here, you don't make it long if you're not tough enough."

* David S. Gottesman, Friend of Warren Buffett, Has Died at Age 96 (Sept. 29)

* Doreen M. Frasca Thrived in Muni Bonds and Funded Airports (Sept. 30)

* Tokyo Chef Was First to Win Michelin Star for Ramen Restaurant (Sept. 30)

People in the wrestling community paid tribute to Ms. Lee after her death.

"The sweetest person that we were blessed to call a friend. Rest Peacefully, Sara," WWE referee Eddie Orengo posted on Twitter.

Professional wrestler Brandi Rhodes also posted on Twitter about Ms. Lee, saying she hadn't met her, but called her energy "beautiful."

"My heart goes out to her family and friends," she said. "It just doesn't make sense sometimes."

Write to Allison Prang at allison.prang@wsj.com

Sara Lee, Former WWE Wrestler and 'Tough Enough' Winner, Dies at 30
